document.docAuthor: Coelho, Luci Boa Nova, Nessimian, Jorge Luiz & Da-Silva, Elidiomar Ribeiro
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Balera Young and redescription of Habralebra gillettei Young (Hemiptera, Cicadellidae, Typhlocybinae) from Viçosa, Minas Gerais State, Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Balera Young and redescription of Habralebra gillettei Young (Hemiptera, Cicadellidae, Typhlocybinae) from Viçosa, Minas Gerais State, Brazil

paragraph.keyLead:
2 Aedeagus inflated, shaft keeled laterally, with 3 apical lobes (
Fig. 16
)....................
B. pellucida (Osborn)
( Bolivia )

3 Aedeagus bifurcated distally (
Fig. 17
).............................................
B. bracata Ruppel
( Colombia )

- Aedeagus not bifurcated, with pair of lateral keels on apical half (
Fig. 18
)....................
B. pusilla Young
( Panama )

- Style with truncate apex (
Fig. 22
)..................................................
B. obtusa Freytag
( Ecuador )

6 Apices of aedeagal processes convergent, in ventral view, near stem base (
Fig. 23
)........
B. napoensis Freytag
( Ecuador )
7 Apex of aedeagus narrow and pointed in ventral view ( Figs 24, 26 ).............................................. 8
- Apex of aedeagus not pointed in ventral view ( Figs 19, 28 )................................................... 9

8 Style slightly angled on apical half (
Fig. 25
); pygofer long, with posterior margin well developed, narrowly rounded off..................................................................................
B. plagata Freytag
( Ecuador )

- Style strongly angled on apical half (
Fig. 27
); pygofer broad, with posterior margin little developed.................................................................................................
B. ecuadora Freytag
( Ecuador )

9 Posterior margin of pygofer broadly rounded...................
B. caraguatae Young
( Brazil , Panama , Trinidad-Tobago )

- Posterior margin of pygofer with acuminate process............................
B. signata Dworakowska
( Venezuela )

- Aedeagus with three pairs of apical processes (
Fig. 14
).....................................
B. fiuzai
sp.nov.
( Brazil )

11 Dorsoapical pair of aedeagal processes longer than ventral pair (
Fig. 20
)....................
B. myersi Freytag
( Ecuador )

- Dorsoapical pair of aedeagal processes approximately same length than ventral pair (
Fig. 29
)....................................................................................................
B. emarginata (Osborn)
( Bolivia )
